creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: three white birds on tree on R; duck in water with water plants on L
object_name: Six-panel folding screen, one of a pair
text: These paintings of herons, mandarin ducks, pheasants, sparrows, and magpies were originally mounted as sliding wall panels (fusuma). Naonobu served as the official painter for the shogunate in Edo (Tokyo) and Kyoto. (with 2013.29.13.2)
title: Birds in Landscape [right of a pair]
